summary: To respond to COVID-19 , the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services waived Medicare requirements to help health care providers treat patients. We identified 47 waivers and flexibilities, such as waiving about 7,300 fingerprint-based background checks for types of providers posing a high risk of fraud, waste, and abuse. Medicare took some steps to oversee providers who enrolled under waivers and flexibilities, such as investigating...
title: Medicare: CMS Needs to Address Risks Posed by Provider Enrollment Waivers and Flexibilities
